column4: Tesla shares dive 7 percent; still above analysts' target price
column5: NEW YORK Tesla Inc shares slid more than 7 percent on Wednesday  their biggest percentage decline in more than a year  on poorer-than-expected delivery numbers  yet the luxury electric carmaker's stock price remained above analysts' median target.

column4: China's Baidu taps 50 partners to help advance self-driving
column5: DETROIT  July 5 Baidu Inc  the top Chinese internet search firm  has formed a broad alliance to promote self-driving cars  pitting its Apollo platform against Alphabet Inc's system  it said on Wednesday  in hopes of getting the vehicles on the road in China by 2019.

column4: Intel  John McAfee settle lawsuits over antivirus pioneer's name
column5: NEW YORK John McAfee  the creator of eponymous antivirus computer software  has settled a lawsuit against Intel Corp  over his right to use his name on other projects after the chipmaker bought his former company.

column4: Samsung on track to take Intel's chip crown with record second-quarter earnings
column5: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  is expected to report its best-ever quarterly profit in the second quarter  with soaring memory chip sales pushing it past Intel Corp  as the biggest semiconductor maker by revenue for the first time.
